import MethodEndpoint from "@theme/ApiExplorer/MethodEndpoint";
import ParamsDetails from "@theme/ParamsDetails";

<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"Delete purchase order"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"delete"}
  path={"/api/v1.0/purchaseorders/{PurchaseOrderId}"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



Deletes a purchase order by its unique identifier. This legacy endpoint is deprecated but may be required for older Parts module workflows.

**Prerequisites**
1. **PurchaseOrderId** - Use [GET /api/v1.0/purchaseorders](/docs/api/parts/list-purchase-orders) and extract `Items[].PurchaseOrderId`.

**Workflow Example**
1. List purchase orders and select the PO to remove.
2. [DELETE /api/v1.0/purchaseorders/\{PurchaseOrderId\}](/docs/api/parts/delete-purchase-order).
3. Confirm removal by reloading [GET /api/v1.0/purchaseorders](/docs/api/parts/list-purchase-orders).

**Minimal Required Fields**: PurchaseOrderId (path).

<Heading
  id={"request"}
  as={"h2"}
  className={"openapi-tabs__heading"}
  children={"Request"}
>
</Heading>

<ParamsDetails
  parameters={[{"name":"PurchaseOrderId","in":"path","required":true,"description":"Unique identifier of the purchase order to delete.","schema":{"type":"string","format":"uuid"}}]}
>
  
</ParamsDetails>

<RequestSchema
  title={"Body"}
  body={undefined}
>
  
</RequestSchema>

<StatusCodes
  id={undefined}
  label={undefined}
  responses={{"200":{"description":"Purchase order deleted successfully.","content":{"application/json":{"schema":{"type":"object","description":"Response returned after successfully deleting a resource. >
  
</StatusCodes>
